column2: U.S. high court conflicted over Limelight Networks patent fight WASHINGTON
column3: April 30 The U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday appeared unsure how to proceed in a dispute over whether Limelight Networks Inc infringed upon patented technology for managing Web images and video held by Akamai Technologies Inc.

ESRX,BRIEF-Express Scripts weighs options regarding costly Sovaldi hepatitis C drug April 30 Express Scripts Holding Co :  * Says considering a number of initiatives to benefit clients and patients 
XOM,Exxon Mobil boosts dividend by 10 percent April 30 Exxon Mobil Corp, the world's largest publicly traded oil company, said on Thursday it would raise its quarterly dividend by 10 percent.

Thomas Middleditch might be channeling an early version of Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg, with his hoodie, ginger hair, social awkwardness and twitchy nervousness.   
FDX,Guard in critical condition after Georgia FedEx facility shooting ATLANTA, April 30 A security guard for a FedEx Corp facility in suburban Atlanta was in critical condition on Wednesday, a day after police said he was shot by a co-worker who also wounded five others in a blast of gunfire before killing himself. 
F,Ford begins production of Transit vans in Missouri DETROIT, April 30 Ford Motor Co on Wednesday formally marked the end of a profitable half-century run for its E-Series commercial van, trumpeting the start of North American production of the replacement Transit van at its Kansas City assembly plant. 
GRMN,Garmin revenue up as fitness, aviation sales riseUPDATE 1-Garmin results tops estimates as fitness, aviation sales rise April 30 Garmin Ltd reported a better-than-expected 10 percent rise in quarterly revenue as higher sales of its fitness and aviation devices made up for shrinking sales of personal navigation devices, a market it once dominated.  UPDATE 1-Garmin results tops estimates as fitness, aviation sales rise April 30 Garmin Ltd reported a better-than-expected 10 percent rise in quarterly revenue as higher sales of its fitness and aviation devices made up for shrinking sales of personal navigation devices, a market it once dominated. April 30 Garmin Ltd reported a 10 percent rise in quarterly revenue, helped by higher sales of its fitness and aviation navigation devices.UPDATE 1-Garmin results tops estimates as fitness, aviation sales rise April 30 Garmin Ltd reported a better-than-expected 10 percent rise in quarterly revenue as higher sales of its fitness and aviation devices made up for shrinking sales of personal navigation devices, a market it once dominated.

CEO Barra leans on small circle of GM veteransUPDATE 1-U.S. government says it lost $11.2 billion on GM bailout WASHINGTON The U.S. government lost $11.2 billion on its bailout of General Motors Co, more than the $10.3 billion the Treasury Department estimated when it sold its remaining GM shares in December, according to a government report released on Wednesday.  UPDATE 1-U.S. government says it lost $11.2 billion on GM bailout WASHINGTON The U.S. government lost $11.2 billion on its bailout of General Motors Co, more than the $10.3 billion the Treasury Department estimated when it sold its remaining GM shares in December, according to a government report released on Wednesday. GS,Nomura profit falls as 'Abenomics' euphoria fadesUPDATE 3-Nomura profit falls as 'Abenomics' euphoria fades * Q4 net profit at 61.3 bln yen, beats 41 bln yen analyst view  UPDATE 3-Nomura profit falls as 'Abenomics' euphoria fades * Q4 net profit at 61.3 bln yen, beats 41 bln yen analyst view TOKYO Nomura Holdings , Japan's biggest investment banking and brokerage group, reported its first profit decline in seven quarters as waning enthusiasm over Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's economic stimulus policies brought down stock trading volumes.UPDATE 3-Nomura profit falls as 'Abenomics' euphoria fades * Q4 net profit at 61.3 bln yen, beats 41 bln yen analyst view  
HES,Hess quarterly profit drops after year-ago charge April 30 Oil and natural gas producer Hess Corp  on Wednesday reported a sharp drop in first-quarter profit, against results one year ago that were boosted by a gain from the sale of some properties. 
HPQ,HP, Foxconn launch cloud server joint venture April 30 Hewlett-Packard Co and Taiwanese contract electronics manufacturer Foxconn Technology Group launched a joint venture to make servers aimed at companies which provide cloud computing services. 
IP,Int'l Paper posts 1st-qtr loss after Alabama mill closure charge April 30 International Paper Co, the largest North American producer of corrugated shipping boxes, posted a quarterly loss on Wednesday due to charges to close an Alabama paper mill. 
JNJ,J&J; suspends sale of device used in fibroid surgery - WSJUPDATE 1-J&J; suspends sale of device used in fibroid surgeryEnergizer to split into battery, personal care companies Energizer Holdings Inc  said it plans to separate into two publicly traded companies, one for batteries and other household products and the other for personal care brands such as Schick razors and Stayfree female hygiene products.  Energizer to split into battery, personal care companies Energizer Holdings Inc  said it plans to separate into two publicly traded companies, one for batteries and other household products and the other for personal care brands such as Schick razors and Stayfree female hygiene products. LEN,YOUR MONEY-How to give Grandma more than just a spare room NEW YORK, April 30 When it came time for Tom Moser and his wife to consider having his 83-year-old father move in with them, a house with a special multigenerational floor plan solved their problems - and may have saved his dad's life. 
MA,NY state joins with Visa, MasterCard to curb payday lending April 30 New York state's main banking regulator said on Wednesday it had teamed up with card payment companies Visa Inc and MasterCard Inc to curb illegal payday loans through debit card transactions.

MET,Derivative gain boosts MetLife profitUPDATE 1-MetLife results miss estimates as claims increase April 30 MetLife Inc, the largest U.S. life insurer, reported a 36 percent rise in net income, helped by a derivative gain linked to credit spreads, but operating earnings fell short of market expectations as claims increased.  UPDATE 1-MetLife results miss estimates as claims increase April 30 MetLife Inc, the largest U.S. life insurer, reported a 36 percent rise in net income, helped by a derivative gain linked to credit spreads, but operating earnings fell short of market expectations as claims increased. April 30 MetLife Inc, the largest U.S. life insurer, reported a 36 percent rise in quarterly earnings, helped by a derivative gain linked to credit spreads.UPDATE 1-MetLife results miss estimates as claims increase April 30 MetLife Inc, the largest U.S. life insurer, reported a 36 percent rise in net income, helped by a derivative gain linked to credit spreads, but operating earnings fell short of market expectations as claims increased.  
MSFT,Microsoft's Xbox One console to go on sale in China in September SAN FRANCISCO, April 29 Microsoft Corp  will begin selling its Xbox One video game console in China in September through its partnership with Chinese Internet TV company BesTV New Media Co, the company said on Tuesday.

NDAQ,Nasdaq OMX lowers clearing fees, expands eligible collateral LONDON, April 30 Transatlantic exchange operator Nasdaq OMX has lowered clearing fees and expanded the list of assets that can be used as collateral at its Nordic clearing house after the business was authorised under new European Union rules.
